member.name: T:TwitchLib.Logging.StreamLogger
member.summary: The Stream Logger class. This class can stream log information to any stream, it is suitable for storing a log file to disk, or to a MemoryStream for testing your components.
member.remarks: This logger is not thread safe.

member.name: M:TwitchLib.Logging.StreamLogger.#ctor(System.String,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Creates a new StreamLogger with default encoding and buffer size. Initial Level is set to Debug.
member.param: The name of the log.
The stream that will be used for logging, seeking while the logger is alive

member.name: M:TwitchLib.Logging.StreamLogger.#ctor(System.String,System.IO.Stream,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Creates a new StreamLogger with default buffer size. Initial Level is set to Debug.
member.param: The name of the log.
The stream that will be used for logging, seeking while the logger is alive
The encoding that will be used for this stream.

member.name: M:TwitchLib.Logging.StreamLogger.#ctor(System.String,System.IO.Stream,System.Text.Encoding,System.Int32)

The stream that will be used for logging, seeking while the logger is alive
The encoding that will be used for this stream.
The buffer size that will be used for this stream.

member.name: M:TwitchLib.Logging.StreamLogger.#ctor(System.String,System.IO.StreamWriter)
member.summary: Creates a new StreamLogger with Debug as default Level.
member.param: The name of the log.
The StreamWriter the log will write to.

member.name: T:TwitchLib.Logging.StreamLoggerFactory
member.summary: Creates outputing to files. The name of the file is derived from the log name plus the 'log' extension.

member.name: T:TwitchLib.Logging.TraceLogger
member.summary: The TraceLogger sends all logging to the System.Diagnostics.TraceSource built into the .net framework.
member.remarks:
Logging can be configured in the system.diagnostics configuration section.
If logger doesn't find a source name with a full match it will use source names which match the namespace partially.
If no portion of the namespace matches the source named "Default" will be used.

member.name: M:TwitchLib.Logging.TraceLogger.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Build a new trace logger based on the named TraceSource
member.param: The name used to locate the best TraceSource. In most cases comes from the using type's fullname.

member.name: M:TwitchLib.Logging.TraceLogger.#ctor(System.String,TwitchLib.Logging.LoggerLevel)
member.summary: Build a new trace logger based on the named TraceSource
member.param: The name used to locate the best TraceSource. In most cases comes from the using type's fullname.
The default logging level at which this source should write messages. In almost all cases this default value will be overridden in the config file.

member.name: M:TwitchLib.Logging.TraceLogger.CreateChildLogger(System.String)
member.summary: Create a new child logger. The name of the child logger is [current-loggers-name].[passed-in-name]
member.param: The Subname of this logger.
member.returns: The New ILogger instance.

member.name: T:TwitchLib.Logging.TraceLoggerFactory
member.summary: Used to create the TraceLogger implementation of ILogger interface. See .

member.name: T:TwitchLib.TwitchAPI
member.summary: Fully featured Twitch API wrapper.

member.name: M:TwitchLib.TwitchAPI.Channels.v5.GetChannelAsync(System.String)
member.summary:
[ASYNC] Gets a channel object based on a specified OAuth token.
Get Channel returns more data than Get Channel by ID because Get Channel is privileged.
Required Authentication Scope: channel_read
member.returns: A ChannelPrivileged object including all Channel object info plus email and streamkey.

member.name: M:TwitchLib.TwitchAPI.Channels.v5.GetChannelByIDAsync(System.String)
member.summary: [ASYNC] Gets a speicified channel object.
member.param: The specified channelId of the channel to get the information from.
member.returns: A Channel object from the response of the Twitch API.

member.name: M:TwitchLib.TwitchAPI.Channels.v5.UpdateChannelAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.String)
member.summary:
[ASYNC] Updates specified properties of a specified channel.
In the request, the new properties are specified as a JSON object representation.
Required Authentication Scopes: To update delay or channel_feed_enabled parameter: a channel_editor token from the channel owner. To update other parameters: channel_editor.
member.param: The specified channelId of the channel to get the information from.
Description of the broadcasters status, displayed as a title on the channel page.
Name of the game.
Channel delay, in seconds. This inserts a delay in the live feed. Requires the channel owners OAuth token.
If true, the channels feed is turned on. Requires the channel owners OAuth token. Default: false.
member.returns: A Channel object with the newly changed properties.

member.name: M:TwitchLib.TwitchAPI.Channels.v5.GetChannelEditorsAsync(System.String,System.String)

summary.para: [ASYNC] Gets a list of users who are editors for a specified channel.

member.param: The specified channelId of the channel to get the information from.
member.returns: A ChannelEditors object that contains an array of the Users which are Editor of the channel.

member.name: M:TwitchLib.TwitchAPI.Channels.v5.GetChannelFollowersAsync(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String,System.String)

summary.para: [ASYNC] Gets a list of users who follow a specified channel, sorted by the date when they started following the channel (newest first, unless specified otherwise).

member.param: The specified channelId of the channel to get the information from.
Maximum number of objects to return. Default: 25. Maximum: 100.
Object offset for pagination of results. Default: 0.
Tells the server where to start fetching the next set of results, in a multi-page response.
Sorting direction. Valid values: "asc", "desc" (newest first). Default: "desc".
member.returns: A ChannelFollowers object that represents the response from the Twitch API.

member.name: M:TwitchLib.TwitchAPI.Channels.v5.GetAllFollowersAsync(System.String)
member.summary: [ASYNC] Gets all of the followers a channel has. THIS IS A VERY EXPENSIVE CALL AND CAN TAKE A LONG TIME IF THE CHANNEL HAS A LOT OF FOLLOWERS. NOT RECOMMENDED.
member.param: THe specified channelId of the channel to get the information from.

member.name: M:TwitchLib.TwitchAPI.Channels.v5.GetChannelTeamsAsync(System.String)

summary.para: [ASYNC] Gets a list of teams to which a specified channel belongs.

member.param: The specified channelId of the channel to get the information from.
member.returns: An Array of the Teams the Channel belongs to.

member.name: M:TwitchLib.TwitchAPI.Channels.v5.GetChannelSubscribersAsync(System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String,System.String)

summary.para: [ASYNC] Gets a list of users subscribed to a specified channel, sorted by the date when they subscribed.

member.param: The specified channelId of the channel to get the information from.
Maximum number of objects to return. Default: 25. Maximum: 100.
Object offset for pagination of results. Default: 0.
Sorting direction. Valid values: "asc", "desc" (newest first). Default: "desc".
The associated auth token for this request.

member.name: M:TwitchLib.TwitchAPI.Channels.v5.GetAllSubscribersAsync(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: [ASYNC] Makes a number of calls to get all subscriber objects belonging to a channel. THIS IS AN EXPENSIVE OPERATION.
member.param: ChannelId indicating channel to get subs from.
The associated auth token for this request.

member.name: M:TwitchLib.TwitchAPI.Channels.v5.CheckChannelSubscriptionByUserAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String)

summary.para: [ASYNC] Checks if a specified channel has a specified user subscribed to it. Intended for use by channel owners.
Returns a subscription object which includes the user if that user is subscribed. Requires authentication for the channel.

member.param: The specified channel to check the subscription on.
The specified user to check for.
member.returns: Returns a subscription object or null if not subscribed.

member.name: M:TwitchLib.TwitchAPI.Channels.v5.ResetChannelStreamKeyAsync(System.String,System.String)

summary.para: [ASYNC] Deletes the stream key for a specified channel. Once it is deleted, the stream key is automatically reset.
A stream key (also known as authorization key) uniquely identifies a stream. Each broadcast uses an RTMP URL that includes the stream key. Stream keys are assigned by Twitch.

member.param: The specified channel to reset the StreamKey on.
member.returns: A ChannelPrivileged object that also contains the email and stream key of the channel aside from the normal channel values.

member.returns: A Community object that represents the community the channel is in.
